item.title: Welcome Flaticons!
item.description:
Whew! Watch out for that first step. It's a doozy!

Our First Premium Icon Set!

Today we are crazy amazeballs excited to announce our first Premium Icon Set on Fonticons. And it's a doozy! Weighing in at 500 icons in each of two different styles, Flaticons is a paragon of beauty and consistency across the entire set. It's seriously gorgeous.

So without further ado, I present to you Flaticons Solid and Stroke by the venerable Zach Roszczewski!

Flaticons Solid — $30

Flaticons Stroke — $30

What You Get When You Buy

  • The Premium Icon Set will be available in all of the Kits in your Fonticons account.
  • You'll be able to download the full icon set, including font formats and CSS, to use offline and on the desktop.

About Zach Roszczewski

If you don't know who Zach Roszczewski is, you should. He's a super crazy talented icon and illustration designer. He's the guy who created the personality-ridden icon set for AirBNB.

Scope his work on Dribbble, stalk him on the Twitters, and check out his Icon Sets on Fonticons.

item.title: Simplify, Simplify.
item.description:
“Our life is frittered away by detail. Simplify, simplify.”

We recently made things simpler on Fonticons. First, we changed plans and pricing:

  • Clarified what each plan gets.
  • All paid plans now get the full Starter Library.
  • Changed to a simpler yearly billing option.

We also simplified the Kit interaction. This should be especially helpful for new users:

  • Removed all the confusing steps.
  • No longer need to add an icon set before you can start adding icons.
  • All important actions are now right on the Kit page — settings, publish kit, edit icon, etc.
  • New Kits can start with the 20 most popular Font Awesome icons or they can start empty.

We're confident this is the right mental model for interacting with Kits. But we know we have a lot of work left to speed things up for our serious users, so stay tuned for improvements when adding multiple icons. We hear you, and we're working on it!

item.title: Four New Icon Sets
item.description:
“Henry Swanson's my name, and excitement's my game."

As you can probably guess, icons get us pretty excited. We love them so much we just can't stop ourselves from adding more. Today I get to announce the addition of 4 new, beautiful icon sets to Fonticons!

We've added Entypo, Material Design, MD Community and Weather Icons to our icon sets. With these additions you have a whopping 2,435 more icons to choose from when building your site! (I personally get a kick out of this one.)

We work hard to make sure you have just the right icons to make your web sites and applications absolutely gorgeous. If you have an icon set you love and want to see in Fonticons, let us know! We're always listening.

item.title: Stay, Unicode, Stay. Good Unicode.
item.description:
“You said stay so I stayed."

One of the best things about my job is getting to deliver a feature our awesome users have asked for. Today, I am happy to announce changes to how unicode values are handled in your kits!

Before when you added icons to a kit we waited until you published the kit to assign a unicode value to it. The problem was that when you removed an earlier icon all the unicode values could get shuffled when publishing the kit again.

Now when you add an icon to a kit we generate its unicode value right then. You have the ability to change this value on the "Tweak Kit" tab of your kit's settings. You can also see these values in the kit's documentation found under the "Publish Kit" tab.

With this change we hope to make the transition from regular Font Awesome to using Fonticons much easier. We also hope that this will allow our users to do some new and amazing things in their CSS with their kits.

We try very hard to make Fonticons the best it can be. We're always listening to new suggestions, so keep'em coming!

item.title: Copy & Paste from Illustrator CC, Enterprise Services, and Free Accounts
item.description:
Copy & Paste from Illustrator CC!

Just minutes ago, we added the ability to copy from Illustrator CC and paste directly into a new custom icon on Fonticons!

All you have to do is:

  • Open up your vector file in Illustrator.
  • Select and copy the icon you'd like to add to Fonticons. The icon needs to be a single color vector with non-overlapping paths.
  • Switch over to Fonticons and click on "Your Custom Icons," then "Add Icon."
  • Name your icon, then paste into the "Paste from Illustrator CC" field.
  • Submit your icon, and you're good to go!

Travis put together a snazzy video:

Enterprise Services

We've had a considerable amount of interest from folks who are looking for more than the 10 million pageviews our Agency plan provides. So we're proud to announce our custom Enterprise services! You'll get all the great things from our other Fonticons plans, plus VIP support, and any number of pageviews your business needs! Interested? Just fill out our form, and we'll get back to you right quick.

The Free Plan is Back!

After much consideration, we've decided to bring back the Fonticons Free Plan! Feel free to head on over to the sign up page and select the Free Plan.

item.title: Kit Download and Annual Billing
item.description:
At Fonticons, we're hard at work every day making things better. We listen closely to each and every conversation we have to see where we should make changes. You've given us a ton of great feedback and ideas, so thank you!

Kit Download

The most common request we've had is for the ability to download your kits. If you've got your own asset workflow or CDN, it can be important to have full control over where things are served from.

So we're proud to announce that you can now download directly from the "Publish Kit" step when you're editing your kit!

We've also got some more improvements coming soon for kit download: - Full kit documentation as a static HTML file - Woff2 support!

Annual Billing

To enable Kit Download, you'll need to switch to Annual Billing. We're also throwing in 2 free months when you switch!

There's a link right under the Download Kit button:

More to Come!

We've got a lot more up our sleeves to make Fonticons better, so stay tuned. Have any issues, ideas, or thoughts? Drop us a note at support@fonticons.com!

item.title: Black Tie!
item.description:
We're super excited to announce the addition of Black Tie to Fonticons! It is immediately available for folks on the Freelancer, Studio, and Agency plans!

Black Tie?

Black Tie is the first commercial icon set I've created, and I'm really proud of it. The big idea behind Black Tie is that icons should come in different visual weights, just as different font weights are an important part of traditional typography.

Stylistically, my goal with Black Tie was to create a clean, minimalist set of icons that will feel right at home next to modern sans-serif fonts like Helvetica and Proxima Nova. You can check out the Kickstarter page to see the story.

Here's a sneak peek (I'm especially proud of cut, copy and paste):

Want to see the full set? Head on over to Fonticons to check out the 4 different weights.

item.title: Changes and Updates
item.description:
Invites, Invites, Invites

Yesterday we sent out several thousand invites to many of you that have been waiting. The response has been overwhelming and we're adding capacity to handle the increased traffic! Thanks for being patient as we iron things out a bit. :)

Changes to Plans

Today, we added the Blogger plan at $4 a month. This plan is designed to meet the needs of some of our more casual users that also want access to lots of great icon sets and more custom icons.

During beta testing, we included an option for folks to be able to use the service for free. This has been a huge help for us to work out the kinks and get some great feedback.

Next week, we'll be removing the ability for new users to sign up for the free account. We'll continue supporting the free plans for everyone who signed up early as a thank you for helping us out early on. So THANK YOU!

If you're looking for a great free option for using Font Awesome, BootstrapCDN is fantastic. As always, thanks to the venerable MaxCDN for hosting!

Black Tie coming in February!

I'm putting the finishing touches on Black Tie, the multi-weight, commercial icon font I Kickstarted last year. As soon as it's ready, we'll be adding this icon set to the Freelancer, Studio, and Agency plans in February.

Changes Based on Feedback

Based on great feedback from our early users, we're working on making a few changes:

  • No credit card required for free trial
  • Yearly billing options
  • Options for kit download
  • Commercial icon sets! We're working on a few deals to bring some absolutely amazing icon sets into Fonticons. We'll keep you posted with any news!

item.title: New Year, New Feature, and New Updates!
item.description:
Custom Icons!

“Everything’s shiny, Cap’n."

What could possibly be better than adding a sweet icon to your kit from one of our family of icon fonts? Why, a most excellent icon you designed yourself, of course!

Dave and I are really pumped to announce the availability of custom icons in Fonticons. Upload your SVG, then you can add your custom icon to any of your kits. We're already using this feature today on the blog!

Thanks to some great user feedback, our Free plan now has the ability to try out custom icons as well! We really think you're going to love adding your own custom icons. And if you don't yet have a Fonticons account, you can request an invite today.

Font Awesome Black Tie

Black Tie is going through some finishing touches, and Dave says it should be ready soon. We are happy to announce that Black Tie will be available for our Freelancer, Studio, and Agency plans!

Font Awesome 4.3

Font Awesome 4.3 should be coming soon, and we'll have it added to Fonticons shortly thereafter. Make sure you get in your icon requests added to GitHub!

Thank You!

Thank you to all those that have signed up and tried out Fonticons. We are constantly striving to make Fonticons the best platform for icons on the web. We appreciate all feedback and hope to make 2015 a banner year.

item.title: Invites and Custom Icons
item.description:
Invitations are going out!

Travis and I are crazy excited (yep, again), because we just sent out the first batch of Fonticons Beta invitations! We're rolling them out slowly to make sure everything goes smoothly. If you already requested for an invitation, you should be getting it in the next few days!

If you have any issues or usability suggestions, please please talk to us! As we said in our last post, the easiest way to get in touch with us is our public channel on HipChat (during US business hours). Otherwise, hit us up on email at dave@fonticons.com or travis@fonticons.com.

Up Next: Custom Icons

Next, we're working on implementing custom icons for the beta. I've mapped out use cases, workflows, and the HTML & CSS prototypes are ready to go. Today, Travis is starting implementation. We're expecting to have those ready sometime in the next month.
